kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
While Sean is correct that you should look into the reason *why* you need to tweak it, there are cases where you want some settings that a scheduled task uses, and may want those controlled in the CMS (example, say you have a scheduled task that purges old comments, you may want the # of days configurable in case you want to change that).
I would use the [KenticoDevTrev/XperienceCommunity.ChannelSettings: Module to easily create and manage Channel Specific Settings in Xperience by Kentico](https://github.com/KenticoDevTrev/XperienceCommunity.ChannelSettings) module. This allows you to easily add settings for the channel and retrieve them, with fall backs. Then you simply retrieve your settings module in your scheduled task.
